plugins.name: Radial & Angular Blur FX
plugins.description:
Radial & Spin Blur is a professional Figma plugin that lets you add cinematic zoom or spin blurs in seconds while keeping full creative control.


Radial Blur (Zoom). Simulates rushing toward/away from a point (motion graphics, depth focus).

Spin Blur (Angular). Rotates pixels around a center (energetic, surreal visuals).

Anaglyph 3D (optional). Adds subtle red/cyan offset (retro depth accents).


Key features

  1. Live Preview ‚Äì Resizable preview area shows the effect before you commit.
  2. 5 √ó 5 Focal-Point Grid ‚Äì Pick any corner, edge, or true center.
  3. Smooth Intensity Slider ‚Äì From whisper-soft haze to dramatic streaks.
  4. Large-Image Support ‚Äì Works on layers / frames up to 1000 px with smart scaling.
  5. No Clipping ‚Äì Padding logic prevents cut-offs even at high values or off-center points.
  6. One-Click Apply ‚Äì Happy with the look? Hit Apply and you‚Äôre done.
  7. Modern UI ‚Äì Fast, accessible, dark-mode aware.
  8. Usage Analytics ‚Äì Pseudonymous event data is sent to Amplitude to improve performance and roadmap decisions (no personal identifiers are collected).


Typical workflow

  1. Select a layer or frame (‚â§ 1000 px).
  2. Pick Radial (Zoom) or Spin (Angular).
  3. Set the center on the 5√ó5 grid and adjust intensity.
  4. Preview the result live.
  5. Apply the blur ‚Äî undo-friendly and non-destructive.


Perfect for

UI/UX designers, illustrators, social-media creators, or anyone who wants studio-grade motion blurs inside Figma.


Built with TypeScript, Figma Plugin API, and Amplitude telemetry for anonymous usage insights.


Help

Tweet/X me @antongridz for feedback and help.

accepted.name: Anton Gridz
accepted.description: I'm a product designer with 13+ years of experience building tools for startups and growing teams.

plugins.tagline: Zoom- or spin-style blur with live preview, 5√ó5 focal grid, anaglyph toggle, and one-click apply.

plugins.name: Styles Manager
plugins.description:
Effortless Style Management in Figma


Take full control of your colors, text styles, effects, and grids with Styles Manager ‚Äì the ultimate tool for organizing, duplicating, and editing styles in Figma. No more manual copying or messy style structures ‚Äì streamline your workflow and keep everything structured in just a few clicks!


Bulk Duplicate Folders & Styles

  1. Preserve the original hierarchy when duplicating styles and folders.
  2. Keep all Variables links intact for a seamless workflow.


Batch Selection & Actions

  1. Select multiple styles within a folder and apply actions at once.
  2. Duplicate or delete entire groups of styles instantly.


Full Control Over Text Styles

  1. Easily rename, duplicate, and delete text styles.
  2. Maintain the folder structure while working with multiple styles.


Instant Effect Type Recognition

  1. Identify Drop Shadows, Blurs, and Inner Shadows at a glance.
  2. Edit and organize effect styles as easily as colors and fonts.


Manage Grid Styles Efficiently

  1. Quickly duplicate, remove, or organize grid styles while preserving settings.
  2. Select multiple grid styles at once for bulk actions.


Why Use Styles Manager?


  1. Saves time by automating repetitive tasks.
  2. Keeps everything structured ‚Äì no more lost or unorganized styles.
  3. Ensures consistency across projects with preserved Variables and hierarchy.


Upgrade your workflow and take full control of your Figma styles today!


üîó Behance

üîó Dribbble

üîó Email

plugins.name: IconAutomation
plugins.description:
### **Comprehensive Guide to the IconAutomation Figma Plugin**


#### **Introduction**


**IconAutomation** is a powerful tool designed to streamline and automate the process of publishing icons within Figma. By integrating with GitLab CI, this plugin ensures your icon sets are always up-to-date and consistent across all platforms. Whether you're a designer working on a small project or part of a large team managing complex design systems, IconAutomation saves time and effort while eliminating manual workflows.


This plugin is primarily tailored for enterprise scenarios. Our company aims to build an internal icon library using Figma and GitLab as a replacement for Iconfont, which suffers from the following limitations:


- **Management Complexity**: Managing Iconfont requires multiple accounts and frequent importing/exporting between design files, Iconfont platforms, and code repositories.

- **Icon Accumulation**: Over time, unused icons accumulate and are loaded all at once in projects, preventing on-demand loading.

- **Font-Based Limitations**: Font-based icons may render blurry or pixelated on high-resolution screens.

- **Icon Conflicts**: Conflicts can arise when using multiple Iconfont libraries, leading to incorrect icon displays.


IconAutomation addresses these issues by leveraging SVGs to build a scalable internal icon library. Once configured, updating both the icon library and code repository can be done with a single click. Unlike font-based solutions, SVGs enable granular control over icon usage‚Äîonly the icons actually used in a project are bundled, preventing unnecessary bloat.


#### **Core Features**


- **One-Click Publishing**: Publish icons directly from Figma with a single action.

- **GitLab Integration**: Seamlessly connect with GitLab CI/CD pipelines for automated workflows.

- **Version Control**: Automatically manage semantic versioning in `package.json`.

- **Diff Generation**: Compare current and historical icons to generate detailed change reports.

- **Branch Automation**: Create feature branches, submit merge requests (MRs), and clean up temporary branches automatically.

- **SVG Optimization**: Optimize icon assets for performance using industry-standard tools.


#### **Prerequisites**


- **GitLab Instance**: A deployed GitLab instance (cloud-based or self-hosted).

- **Template Repository**: Deploy the `react-icons` template repository to your GitLab instance.

- **Figma Client**: Install the IconAutomation plugin via Figma's Community portal.

- **Plugin Configuration**: Configure essential settings as outlined below.


#### **Configuration Guide**


##### **GitLab Settings**


- **Domain**: The URL of your GitLab instance (e.g., `https://gitlab.com`).

- **Project ID**: Found under your repository‚Äôs **Settings > General**.

- **Access Token**: Generate a token with `api`, `read_repository`, and `write_repository` scopes from GitLab‚Äôs **Profile > Access Tokens**.


##### **Figma Plugin Setup**


1. Install the plugin and grant necessary permissions.

2. Navigate to the plugin settings and input your GitLab domain, project ID, and access token.

3. Validate the connection to ensure seamless integration.


#### **Design Specifications**


##### **Page Naming Conventions**


- Pages intended for publishing **must** include the keyword "icon" (e.g., `product-icons`, `system-icons`).

- Only frames under these pages will be processed by the plugin.


##### **Frame Requirements**


- Frames must be named with one of the following suffixes:

- **Outlined**: For icons with stroke-based designs (e.g., `Navigation-Outlined`).

- **Filled**: For solid-filled icons (e.g., `Actions-Filled`).

- **Colored**: For multi-color icons, further categorized as:

- **Light**: Optimized for light backgrounds.

- **Dark**: Optimized for dark backgrounds.


##### **Icon Layer Rules**


- All icons **must** be Figma components (not frames or groups).

- Verify component status by selecting a layer‚Äîthe top panel should display "Component."


##### **Naming Standards**


- Use **Upper Camel Case** (e.g., `AlertCircle`, `SettingsGear`).

- Append style suffixes (e.g., `AlertCircleOutlined`, `SettingsGearFilled`).

- Avoid special characters (`-`, `_`, spaces) and numeric suffixes unless intrinsic to the icon‚Äôs name (e.g., `Star1` is allowed; `Star 1` is invalid).

- Ensure uniqueness within each category to prevent conflicts.


#### **Automated Workflow**


1. **Repository Setup**: Configure GitLab details in the plugin settings.

2. **Local Validation**:

- The plugin checks for naming compliance, duplicates, and structural errors.

- Invalid icons are flagged with actionable feedback.

3. **Branch Management**:

- A temporary branch (e.g., `figma-update-20231001`) is created from `master`.

- Semantic versioning updates `package.json` (e.g., `1.2.0` ‚Üí `1.3.0` for minor changes).

4. **Diff Analysis**:

- Compares current icons against the latest `master` commit.

- Generates a report detailing additions, modifications, and deletions.

5. **Asset Export**:

- Exports SVGs via Figma‚Äôs API and organizes them into folders (e.g., `/outlined`, `/filled`).

- Applies SVGO optimizations to reduce file size.

6. **Merge Request (MR)**:

- Submits an MR with a standardized title (e.g., `[Figma]: add icons`).

- Auto-merges after passing CI checks (linting, build tests).


#### **Best Practices**


- **Consistent Naming**: Adhere strictly to naming conventions to avoid validation failures.

- **Modular Design**: Build icons as reusable components with standardized dimensions (e.g., 24x24px).

- **Version Tracking**: Maintain a `CHANGELOG.md` to document icon updates and deprecations.

- **Performance Checks**: Audit SVG complexity to ensure optimal rendering (e.g., simplify paths for small icons).


#### **Example Scenarios**


##### **Scenario 1: Updating an Icon Set**


1. Add new icons to the `Actions-Filled` frame in Figma.

2. Run the plugin to validate and generate diffs.

3. Submit an MR to deploy changes to production.


##### **Scenario 2: Migrating Legacy Iconfont Icons**


1. Import existing Iconfont SVGs into a `Legacy-Outlined` frame.

2. Use the plugin to publish them as SVGs and update project imports.


#### **Troubleshooting**


| Issue | Solution |

| ------------------------ | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |

| **Naming Errors** | Check for invalid characters or duplicates using the plugin‚Äôs validation tool. |

| **Merge Conflicts** | Resolve conflicts manually in GitLab before re-running the plugin. |

| **API Timeouts** | Increase timeout thresholds in GitLab CI settings or split large icon sets. |

| **SVG Rendering Issues** | Convert strokes to outlines and simplify complex paths in Figma. |


#### **Future Roadmap**


- [ ] **GitHub Integration**: Support publishing to GitHub repositories.

- [ ] **Change Preview**: Display a summary of icon changes before publishing.

- [ ] **Enhanced Error Handling**: Provide contextual error messages with resolution steps.

- [ ] **Progress Tracking**: Add a visual progress bar for long-running tasks.


#### **Additional Resources**


- **Figma Documentation**: [Figma Help Center](https://help.figma.com)

- **GitLab CI/CD Guide**: [GitLab CI/CD Documentation](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/ci/)

- **Community Support**: Join discussions on Figma‚Äôs [Community Forum](https://forum.figma.com).
plugins.tagline: This is a plugin that combines Figma + GitLab to achieve automated publication of an icon library.

plugins.name: pluckpluck
plugins.description:
A plugin that just plucks everything from one side of the cursor. Great for making room for that extra page in a flow.


Right click context menu, or simplest ctrl+, cmd+, search for 'pluck'.


Known issue:

If you hold down the right mouse button as you go through the menus, the selection will be wrong, since you moved the mouse sideways. Click and release, then go through the menus.


Will only select items that are frames or layers on the canvas.


Or do the quick action menu: ctrl/cmd+,
plugins.tagline: Pick up and move. Faster.

plugins.name: Liquid Glass
plugins.description:
Liquid Glass creates high-fidelity, scalable glass effects for modern UI designs. Transform any component with sophisticated multi-layered glass effects that automatically scale to fit your design.


‚ú® Features:

- Light Mode and Dark Mode themes to match any design system

- Create pre-configured glass components or apply effects to existing designs

- Preserves original colors with adjustable opacity (optional)


Perfect for creating modern, elegant interfaces with depth and dimension. Whether you're designing tab bars, buttons, cards or custom components, Liquid Glass delivers Apple-inspired glass effects with just a few clicks.


Based on Apple's WWDC25 design language, this plugin brings the latest UI trends to your Figma workflow.

plugins.name: Theme Mode Converter
plugins.description:
The Theme Mode Converter plugin makes it easy to switch your Figma designs between light and dark themes. Whether you're working on a new design system or updating an existing one, this plugin saves you time by automatically converting your design elements between light and dark modes.


Key Features:

  1. Convert selected elements between light and dark themes
  2. Works with nested components and complex designs
  3. Flexible folder structure support (light/.../... or color/light/... etc.)
  4. Clear notifications about conversion results
  5. Preserves your design structure while updating colors


How to Use:

  1. Select the elements you want to convert
  2. Choose either "Convert to Dark Theme" or "Convert to Light Theme" from the plugins menu
  3. The plugin will automatically convert all matching variables
  4. Check the notifications for conversion results


Requirements:

  1. Your design should have matching light and dark mode variables
  2. Variables should follow a consistent naming structure (e.g., light/primary vs dark/primary)


Tips:

  1. Use the plugin early in your design process to ensure consistent theming
  2. Combine with Figma's variable collections for maximum efficiency
  3. Test your designs in both modes to ensure accessibility
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly switch between light and dark themes in your Figma designs with just one click!

Key Features:

  1. Convert selected elements between light and dark themes
  2. Works with nested components and complex designs
  3. Flexible folder structure support (light/.../... or color/light/... etc.)
  4. Clear notifications about conversion results
  5. Preserves your design structure while updating colors


How to Use:

  1. Select the elements you want to convert
  2. Choose either "Convert to Dark Theme" or "Convert to Light Theme" from the plugins menu
  3. The plugin will automatically convert all matching variables
  4. Check the notifications for conversion results


Requirements:

  1. Your design should have matching light and dark mode variables
  2. Variables should follow a consistent naming structure (e.g., light/primary vs dark/primary)


Tips:

  1. Use the plugin early in your design process to ensure consistent theming
  2. Combine with Figma's variable collections for maximum efficiency
  3. Test your designs in both modes to ensure accessibility
122718.release_notes: Updated for compatibility with the latest Figma API, including support for async variable operations and improved error handling.
122718.tagline: Effortlessly switch between light and dark themes in your Figma designs with just one click!

plugins.name: Select Below

plugins.name: TypeGrid
plugins.description:
TypeGrid allows you to:

  1. Generate a typescale: Choose your base font size, ratio, and number of steps, and the plugin instantly creates a preview of your typescale.
  2. Apply a baseline grid: Set your baseline unit and rounding mode, and the plugin ensures your text layers align perfectly to the grid.
  3. Create text layers: With a single click, generate text layers for each step in your typescale, automatically named and styled.
  4. Create text styles: Generate Figma text styles for each step in your typescale, making it easy to apply consistent typography throughout your design.
  5. Preview with custom fonts: See how your typescale looks with any font installed on your system, including different weights.
  6. Fine-tune your settings: Adjust your typescale and baseline grid settings in real-time to get the perfect look for your design.
  7. Save time and ensure consistency: Automate the tedious process of creating and managing typescales and baseline grids, saving you time and ensuring consistency across your designs.
plugins.tagline: Streamline typography with typescale previews, text styles, and a consistent baseline grid.

138043.release_notes:
- Line heights now adjust automatically based on font size.
- Small text (16px or less) gets extra spacing for readability.
- Medium and large text gets gradually tighter line heights.
- Big headings (32px+) have tight, bold spacing for better visual impact.
- All sizes now look more balanced and easier to read.
138043.tagline: Streamline typography with typescale previews, text styles, and a consistent baseline grid.

plugins.name: popcons
plugins.description:
Popcons is a powerful Figma plugin that takes icon customization to the next level.

Unlike conventional icon libraries, Popcons allows you to instantly modify and compare different styles, just like fonts.


Once an icon is imported, you can edit, modify, and adjust it with a single button, eliminating the need for manual replacements.

With support for 6 thickness levels, 4 styles (Line, Solid, Line Color, Full Color), and 3 roundness options, Popcons provides unparalleled flexibility. Additionally, icons can be further enhanced with decorative elements to suit your design needs.


Now, icons can seamlessly adapt to your brand identity and design language.


-------------------------------------------------------------------------


Key Features of Popcons


‚úî One-Click Editing ‚Äì Instantly modify icons and compare different styles, just like fonts

‚úî 6 Thickness Levels ‚Äì Easily adjust the weight to fit your design

‚úî 4 Styles ‚Äì

* Line ‚Äì Clean and minimal outline style

* Solid ‚Äì Bold and filled for strong emphasis

* Line Color ‚Äì Customizable stroke color for additional versatility

* Full Color ‚Äì Vibrant and expressive icon style

‚úî 3 Roundness Options ‚Äì Adjust corner roundness to match your aesthetic

‚úî Decorative Additions ‚Äì Enhance icons with additional design elements

‚úî Seamless Figma Integration ‚Äì A smooth, intuitive workflow for designers



-------------------------------------------------------------------------


How Can You Use Popcons?


* UI/UX Design ‚Äì Maintain a consistent icon style across web and mobile apps

* Brand Identity ‚Äì Adjust icons to align with your brand‚Äôs design system

* Presentations & Infographics ‚Äì Visually compelling icons for effective communication

* Developer Collaboration ‚Äì Keep icons flexible and adaptable within a design system

* Quick Style Testing & Comparison ‚Äì Instantly switch between styles and compare different options



-------------------------------------------------------------------------


Why Choose Popcons?


* Font-Like Customization ‚Äì Modify icons dynamically without replacing them

* Time-Saving Workflow ‚Äì Instantly compare and apply different styles with a single click

* Design Consistency ‚Äì Ensure uniformity across your project with structured customization

* Highly Flexible ‚Äì Adapt icons to fit various use cases effortlessly



-------------------------------------------------------------------------


Popcons ‚Äì Make Your Icons Pop, Instantly.
plugins.tagline: Quick & Easy editable Icon tool

plugins.name: Design Drills
plugins.description:
Design Drills

30+ quick exercises to speed-run your design learning!


What you can do?

  1. Fix poorly designed frames to sharpen your skills.
  2. Master core concepts like typography, spacing, and contrast.
  3. Learn through short, focused drills you can do anytime.
  4. Try new exercises added regularly to keep things fresh.


Why Design Drills?

Learning design shouldn‚Äôt mean hours of analyzing UIs and juggling concepts. Design Drills focuses on one skill at a time, making learning effective, approachable, and fun.


Got ideas or feedback?

We‚Äôd love to hear from you! Share your thoughts or report bugs @chow1kaitlin@gmail.com.

Let‚Äôs make design practice simple and rewarding!

plugins.name: sticky-color-counter
plugins.description:
Count the number of stickies by color.

Able to calculate the product by giving each color sticky a unique coefficient.

The sum of the product can be viewed.


The following colors of stickies have their own coefficients by default.

  1. blue: 0.5
  2. green: 1
  3. yellow: 2
  4. red: 3
  5. else: 0
plugins.tagline: Count the number of stickies by color.

plugins.name: Navigator
plugins.description:
Navigator is your personal navigation assistant in Figma. It allows you to bookmark up to 4 frames across your project for instant access. It supports across page access as well.


Navigator is perfect for designers working on large projects, enabling efficient navigation and improved productivity. Leap through your designs with ease and speed up your workflow today!




HOW TO:

Select a frame and click "Add Link" to bookmark it

Use the saved links to instantly navigate to your bookmarked frames

Clear individual links or all links as needed

Toggle the UI to keep your workspace clean
plugins.tagline: Jump between key designs quickly, streamlining workflow in large projects. Save time, stay focused!

plugins.name: Section Marker
plugins.description:
Section Marker streamlines your design process by allowing you to instantly insert labeled frames onto your canvas. With a simple UI, you can select predefined frame sizes and headings to create clear sections within your projects. Ideal for organizing content, marking boundaries, or drafting layouts, Section Marker adds a descriptive heading to each frame for easy navigation and reference. Use Section Marker to keep your design process organized and efficient.


Features:

  • Insert labeled frames with a single click.
  • Customize frame sizes to fit your design needs.
  • Enjoy a minimal and intuitive user interface.
  • Save time with quick-access options for common frame types.


How to Use:

  • Select the type of frame from the plugin UI.
  • Click 'Create' to add the frame to your canvas.
  • Drag the frame to your desired location or let it auto-position at your viewport's center.
plugins.tagline: Instantly insert and label section frames in your designs.

plugins.name: Text Style Creator
plugins.description:
What This Plugin Does

  1. Creates local text styles from any selected text layer
  2. Preserves all typography variable connections (font family, size, weight, etc.)
  3. Automatically finds and applies styles to all matching text layers in the current page


How to Use

  1. Select any text layer that you want to create a style from
  2. Run the plugin


The text style will be named using the content of the selected text layer

The plugin will automatically apply the new style to all text layers with matching properties


Key Features

Supports all typography variables

Batch processing: select multiple text layers to create multiple styles at once

Intelligent matching: finds all text layers with identical properties


Preserves variable connections for:

  1. Font family
  2. Font size
  3. Font style
  4. Font weight
  5. Line height
  6. Letter spacing
  7. Paragraph spacing
  8. Paragraph indent

plugins.name: Paint Mixer - Try for FREE
plugins.description:
Paint Mixer allows you to blend two colors just like in real life, using Kubelka & Munk algorithm to predict how light interacts with mixed pigments under natural light for the most authentic results. Learn More from this video.


Features

  1. Accurately mix two colors using the Kubelka & Munk theory.
  2. Apply the mixed color as a fill or stroke to Figma layers.
  3. Create a 9-step gradient layer and linear-fill layer from the start and end colors.


How to Use

  1. Select the end color from the palette box below.
  2. Rotate the handle clockwise to gradually mix the start color with the end color. Rotate counterclockwise to unmix.
  3. Click the hex code to copy color.
  4. Hover on the dropdown to show more actions (see image 2).
  5. Double-click one of the palettes to change its color.


Tips

  1. Rotate two full revolutions (720¬∞) to completely turn into the end color.
  2. Click 3 dots at the bottom to show more options.
  3. Grabbing the handle further from the center of the wheel gives you more precise control.


Pricing

  1. 10 free actions with full access to all features. Actions include using the mixed color and opening the plugin.
  2. Unlock unlimited access for a one-time purchase.


Credits

  1. This plugin uses spectral.js to handle color mixing which is licensed under the MIT License.
  2. Inspiration from Paper app for iPad.
plugins.tagline: Realistic color blending using Kubelka-Munk theory

plugins.name: Generators & Sync Styles
plugins.description:
Create and Synchronize Local Color and Text Styles


Effortlessly create local color styles from selected frames and rectangles, while also generating global text styles from selected text layers. This plugin streamlines your design process by ensuring consistency across your project.


How it Works:


Selection: Simply select any frames, rectangles, or text layers within your Figma document.

Style Generation: Run the plugin to automatically generate local color styles based on the fill colors of the selected objects. For text layers, global text styles will be created based on the selected text properties.


Synchronization: The plugin intelligently synchronizes identical elements by matching both colors and text styles. Any duplicate styles will be updated accordingly, maintaining a cohesive look throughout your design.


With a clean interface and efficient workflow, this plugin enhances your design efficiency and style management.


Important!

The name of each color style will match the corresponding layer name, while the name of each text style will correspond to the selected text layer name. You can use a "/" in either layer name to organize your styles into groups. All styles will be arranged from largest to smallest based on their size.
plugins.tagline: Effortless style creation and synchronization for your designs!

Figmattack: Your Ultimate Figma Learning Adventure Starts Here! üöÄ


Welcome to the OPEN BETA of Figmattack, the first-ever Figma LMS plugin designed specifically for designers of all levels. Whether you're just starting out or you're a seasoned pro, Figmattack offers an exciting and interactive way to sharpen your skills, take on new challenges, and grow as a designer‚Äîall within Figma!


Why Try Figmattack?


1. Gamified Learning Stages üéÆ

Explore dungeons with progressively challenging stages‚ÄîEasy, Medium, and Hard. Each dungeon tests your design skills with hands-on Exercise Stages, engaging Quizzes, and fast-paced Timebox Stages. It‚Äôs not just learning, it‚Äôs an adventure!


2. Personalized Onboarding

When you start, Figmattack adapts to your current level‚Äîbeginner, intermediate, or expert. You‚Äôll get personalized challenges that help you improve exactly where you need it most.


3. Curated Knowledge Base üìö

Access a handpicked selection of design resources and insights to support your learning journey. Whether you‚Äôre tackling a new concept or refreshing your knowledge, our knowledge base is there to guide you.


Coming Soon to Figmattack!


We‚Äôre in OPEN BETA, and that means new features are on the horizon:


  1. Leaderboard: Compete with other designers, track your progress, and rise to the top.
  2. Learning Paths: Follow structured paths that guide you from beginner to expert.
  3. Community Features: Join challenges, share tips, and collaborate with other designers within Figmattack.


Join the Figmattack Community on Discord!


We're constantly improving, and we want you to help shape Figmattack. If you encounter any bugs, have ideas for improvements, or just want to connect with other designers on the same journey, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!


Join Our Discord and be part of the growing Figmattack community! Share your experience, give feedback, and help us build the future of design learning together.


Get Started with Figmattack Today!


Don‚Äôt wait‚Äîjoin the adventure now and start leveling up your design skills inside Figma! This is your chance to experience Figmattack in its early stages, give your feedback, and watch as new features and stages are added in real-time.


Install Figmattack on Figma and dive into your first design challenge now!


Disclaimer: As we're in OPEN BETA, not all features are available yet, and there may be bugs or areas for improvement. Your feedback is crucial in making Figmattack the best learning tool for designers, so don‚Äôt hesitate to reach out and share your thoughts!

plugins.name: Spacing Token Generator
plugins.description:
üîß What It Does

This Figma plugin helps you automatically generate spacing Tokens based on your preferred scale. Whether you're working with a base-4 or base-8 spacing system‚Äîor even a custom multiplier‚Äîthis tool creates a clean, structured set of spacing tokens to integrate into your design system.



‚öôÔ∏è How It Works


1. Choose Your Base Grid

Start by selecting your preferred spacing grid:

- 4pt scale (perfect for tighter systems)

- 8pt scale (industry standard for scalable design systems)

- Or choose the "Custom" option to set your own base multiplier (e.g., 5, 10, etc.)


2. Add Multipliers

Define the multipliers you want to generate tokens for.

You can:

- Use the default multipliers (e.g., 1x, 2x, 3x...)

- Add your own custom multipliers for more control over your spacing structure.



3. Generate Spacing Tokens

Click "Generate" and the plugin will automatically:

- Create a new variable collection called "Spacing"

- Generate a full set of iTokens (Figma variables) based on your chosen base and multipliers

- Structure them cleanly and consistently for immediate use across your components


üöÄ Why Use It?

- ‚úÖ Save time on repetitive token creation

- ‚úÖ Maintain consistency across your design system

- ‚úÖ Scale your UI spacing logic with precision

- ‚úÖ Easily integrate into Design Tokens pipelines or handoff processes
plugins.tagline: Generate spacing Tokens instantly, right inside Figma.

plugins.name: Paster
plugins.description:
Access advanced pasting functionality with the ability to paste multiple layers simultaneously.


Features

  1. Paste or move layers inside a different frame, maintaining their original positions.
  2. Swap selection with copy, preserving the selection properties.
  3. Replace selection with copy, inheriting the copy properties.
  4. Paste only the properties that matter.


Available properties

  1. Absolute position: supports pasting only x or y.
  2. Auto layout
  3. Corner radius
  4. Effects
  5. Fills
  6. Interactions
  7. Name
  8. Opacity
  9. Rotation
  10. Position (relative): supports pasting only x or y.
  11. Size: supports pasting only width or height
  12. Strokes
  13. Text characters


Soon

  1. Layout grids
  2. Resizing options, like Hug and Fill.
  3. Constraints
  4. Font properties: #TBD
  5. Blend modes
  6. Export settings


Shortcuts

You have to assign them, and it works only on macOS.

  1. Control‚ÄìCommand-C: Copy selection
  2. Control‚ÄìCommand-V: Paste in place
  3. Shift-Control‚ÄìCommand-V: Move in place
  4. Control‚ÄìCommand-S: Swap with copy
  5. Control‚ÄìCommand-R: Replace with copy


Notes

  1. Paste strokes will ignore mixed stroke caps (e.g. rounded + arrow)
  2. Triggering undo after using 'Replace with copy', will prevent the plugin from closing. Reported to Figma - waiting for a solution.
  3. "View logs" is an experimental features available only to "Replace with copy".
plugins.tagline: Choose the properties you want to paste

plugins.name: Variable Sherlock üïµÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è
plugins.description:
Variable Sherlock üïµÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è


Inspect every variable by selecting any layer in your design. Variable Sherlock will get every used variable in the selection, organized by node and specify its:

  1. Variable name
  2. Property applied to
  3. Type of variable
  4. Value of variable
  5. Collection of variable
  6. Library the collection comes from


You can also filter and sort your results to get specific kinds of variables based on name, type, property, etc.


Notes

  1. It can take some time to inspect large selections. If this happens, try to select a smaller amount of layers.
  2. The shown value reflects the value of the variable in the active mode for the layer it is connected to.
  3. Library names can only be shown if the library is imported to the file the plugin is running in. Otherwise, the library name will be left blank.


I'm always trying to improve the plugin. If this was useful for you have any suggestions or find any bug, don't hesitate to send me a message or buy me a coffee!

accepted.name: Rodrigo D√≠az Salvadores
accepted.description: Product Desig Engineer living in Stockholm

plugins.tagline: Inspect used variables in your design: name, type, value, collection & library

plugins.name: Translate AI
plugins.description:
Translate AI empowers you to effortlessly translate content within your designs using the power of AI. Whether you need to translate entire frames, groups, or components, this plugin streamlines the process, enhancing your design workflow.


Features:

Bulk Translation: Translate all selected content at once, saving you time and effort.

Language Suggestions: Get up to three translation outcomes for better language accuracy.

Versatile Application: Works seamlessly with Frames, Groups, Components, and more.

Important Tips:

Avoid Overloading: Translating excessively large amounts of content at once may cause errors.

Font Selection: Always choose the appropriate font for the language you're translating into to ensure accurate rendering.

accepted.name: Crafttor
accepted.description: Increase your & your team productivity with Crafttor.

plugins.name: Cover Letter Panda
plugins.description:
Improve your chances of getting hired with a professional cover letter

Cover Letter Panda helps you generate a professional UX designer cover letter in seconds.


How to use

Simply paste in the job description of the job you are applying to. Optionally, add any relevant experience you have, such as experience in the same industry.


Each cover lettter is in A4 format and be exported as a PDF right away.


Get started for free

Cover Letter Panda comes with 2 free cover letter generations. You can gain additional credits for free, or purchase 20 credits for $20. If you are in a position where you can not afford the credits, please contact me.


Questions & Support

If you have any questions or feedback, please contact me at clpanda@uiuxdesignerjobs.com

plugins.name: Masonry tidy up
plugins.description:
A simple plugin to help get the brain waves flowing as you synthesise sticky notes from workshops or brainstorming sessions.


Key features:

  • Scale sticky notes to all be the same width and the text size will scale too, no more randomly large or small sticky notes causing havoc when trying to align things nicely ‚ú®
  • Control how many sticky notes wide you want your tidied bundle to be
  • Set the spacing between sticky notes when they're tidied, and manually adjust this using the built in pink-line spacing tools native to FigJam
  • See the width of your selection so that you can control how the notes will tidy
  • Keep things fresh and explore different perspectives - the order of the notes will randomly change each time, so you're not stuck reading the same top notes from the same person each time you go to synthesise a new group of notes


~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~

‚òïÔ∏è If you love this plugin and would like to support me, you can buy me a coffee at: https://buymeacoffee.com/figmargaux
plugins.tagline: Tidy up sticky notes into a masonry layout

plugins.name: marketgoo copies
plugins.description:
Plugin to sync copies from Google Spreadsheet to Figma.


How it works?

  1. Create a Google SpreadSheet with two columns. The first column is the copy id, the second column the copy value.
  2. Publish the document to the web (File > Publish to the web) and copy the public URL.
  3. In your Figma document, create text layers using the ids in the Google SpreadSheet as names.
  4. Run marketgoo copies plugin and paste the public URL of your Google SpreadSheet document.
  5. All content of the text layers with the same name as the ids in the Google SpreadSheet will be updated with the final copies.
  6. After editing any copy in the Google Spreadsheet document, just run the plugin again to update the copies in Figma.
  7. Running the plugin after selecting any layer, will update only the selected text layers (instead of the whole document).


Features

  • You can use dynamic variables with the notation {{ varname }} in your copies. The plugin will ask you for the final value.
  • You can use the HTML tag <br> to force a line break.
  • Any other HTML tag will be removed in Figma, but used to detect the ranges of all styles in the a text layer. For example: Hello <strong>world</strong>.
  • The "Reset layer names" command is useful to un-sync copies to the spreadsheet document.
  • The "Get missing copies" command list all text layers whose names do not appear in the spreadsheet. Useful to discover and sync new copies.

plugins.name: PSD Importer for Figma
plugins.description:
Import your PSD files directly into Figma. It preserves the design elements such as layer structure, text properties, and complex styles, offering a smooth transition from Photoshop to Figma.


There are 2 import methods.

  1. Import all layers with maximum compatibility.
  2. Import each layer is bitmap image.


While the plugin strives for high accuracy, some discrepancies may occur due to differences between Photoshop and Figma‚Äôs rendering engines - particularly with complex effects, blending modes, and certain layer styles. In cases where features can‚Äôt be translated, some layers may be imported as images.


Users can try the plugin with three free PSD imports, after which unlimited access is available through an $8/month subscription.
plugins.tagline: Easily import your PSD files in just a few clicks.

plugins.name: Color Analyzer
plugins.description:
Effortlessly extract and display color values from your designs. This plugin automatically updates text layers with HEX and RGB values from a selected frame or reference layer.


Features include:

  1. Extracts color from frame fill or 'ref color' layer
  2. Updates text layers named 'hex' or 'rgb' with corresponding values
  3. Optional auto-contrast feature adjusts text color for readability
  4. Works with any frame, including those with auto layout
  5. Streamlines color documentation in your design files


Perfect for creating color palettes, style guides, or quickly referencing color values in your designs. Boost your workflow efficiency and ensure color consistency across your projects with this easy-to-use plugin.
plugins.tagline: Color Value Extractor

plugins.name: Flow Text Into Components
plugins.description:
‚ÄúFlow Text Into Components‚Äù is a convenient Figma plugin designed to help you easily update text across multiple components in your design projects. This plugin simplifies the process of populating text into components, allowing you to save time and maintain consistency in your designs.


How to Use:


1.Set the text layer names in the master component and ensure the layer names in the instances match.


2.Prepare the text you want to flow into the components, separated by line breaks.


3.Open the plugin and select the group of components where you want to flow the text.


4.Enter the text you want to flow into the plugin.


5.Press the Update button.


If the plugin does not function as expected, check that the layer names in the master component and the instances are aligned. The plugin will not work if the layer names in the instances are inconsistent.
plugins.tagline: Instantly fill components with the right text
